Internship.name: Social AI Lab, Computer Science Department, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam

project.title: VR2Arm: VR Teleoperation for Real-Robot Manipulation

highlights: Deployed a VR controller-based teleoperation interface enabling real-time object manipulation (grasping, moving, rotation) on a physical robotic arm; tested and iteratively refined on hardware.
Designed and conducted a humanâ€“robot interaction user study (N=25); collected and analyzed workload and usability metrics using NASA-TLX, SUS, and qualitative feedback.
Collaborated with researchers and lab engineers; scoped and resolved technical problems; fully documented and open-sourced the system.

Internship.name: ImCare Biotech

project.title: Synthetic Data Augmentation for Early-Stage Liver Cancer Detection

highlights: Improved missing data handling via KNN imputation, increasing predictive sensitivity by 12%.
Applied SMOTE for data augmentation and developed a logistic regression model in PyTorch, achieving an AUC-ROC of 0.87.
Enabled an estimated 680 additional early-stage detections per 100,000 screenings.
Led weekly tutorials, assisted with exercises, and supported students during course sessions.

awards.title: 1st Place in 4th Annual Hack4her

track.name: Ethical AI Agents for Public Services

summary: Hack4her is a national women-in-tech student hackathon.
We awarded first place at for developing an ethical AI system to automate childcare allowance approval processes, with a focus on fairness, transparency, and public-service constraints.

publications.title: Static Is Not Enough: A Comparative Study of VR and SpaceMouse in Static and Dynamic Teleoperation Tasks
publications.venue: ACM/IEEE International Conference on Human-Robot Interaction (HRI)
publications.summary: This work is based on a summer research internship conducted at the Social AI Lab. Accepted to the HRI 2026 Late-Breaking Reports track in January 2026.
